reviews.review_msg: Let's just say, I'm glad that class is over. It was WAY to advanced for being an intro course. If we didn't understand a concept, you would use an example of something we also didn't understand. Lots if confusion, and a very hard marker. I would advise taking the class if you are extremely knowledgable in the field of Theology, if not, stay away.

Prof. Butcher is a brilliant professor who is very, very passionate in the subject that he teaches. I had so much fun in his class and learned so much about Orthodox Christianity. Outside of class, he is very approachable and very friendly with students.

Best Professor EVER, this class was an easy A, hes very informative and a great mind to talk to, i could listen to him talk for ages, the essays were easy and short and the final was straight memorization which he prepared us for, unfortunately hes leaving for Toronto so I wont be able to take another class with him :(
I didn't have him for my tutorials, but from what I read here he sounds like a hard marker. He was a good lecturer, very friendly and obviously interested in the material.  Overall a nice guy.
Tutorials are mandatory, though you'll have to mention something about readings and what you found interesting. Lectures aren't too bad, just not interesting.

This prof is completely incomprehensible. He talks very fast yet he has no idea what he is really talking about. His lectures are very unorganized, and he may like his subject but he has no idea how to teach it. The textbook was very expensive, yet it was not thorough enough for a proper essay.

His instructions are unclear. His class is useless to go to. His expectations are way to high for his short essays. One of my least favorite profs.. try to avoid his tutorial classes or else you'll be forced to find and talk about something interesting every week.
Textbook was sooo boring and we had to read THE WHOLE THING. Expectations are unclear and unreasonable.
